sections.title: Getting Started
sections.content:
Welcome to the EU Trip Tracker! This system helps you monitor compliance with the 90/180 day rule for UK citizens traveling to the Schengen Area.

**What is the 90/180 rule?**
UK citizens can spend up to 90 days in the Schengen Area within any 180-day period. This is a rolling window that moves every day.

**Key Features:**
â€¢ Track all employee trips to EU countries
â€¢ Monitor compliance in real-time
â€¢ Visual calendar view of travel patterns
â€¢ Export data for reporting
â€¢ GDPR-compliant data management

**Getting Started:**
1. Add your employees to the system
2. Log their trips (past and future)
3. Monitor the dashboard for compliance status
4. Use forecasting to plan future travel

sections.title: The 90/180 Day Rule Explained
sections.content:
Understanding the 90/180 rule is crucial for compliance. Here's how it works:

**The Rule:**
UK citizens can spend a maximum of 90 days in the Schengen Area within any 180-day period.

**Key Concepts:**
â€¢ **Rolling Window**: The 180-day period moves every day
â€¢ **Schengen Area**: 26 European countries with no internal border controls
â€¢ **Counting Days**: Only days physically present in Schengen countries count
â€¢ **Ireland**: Tracked separately - doesn't count toward the 90-day limit

**How We Calculate:**
1. Look at the last 180 days from today
2. Count all days spent in Schengen countries
3. Show remaining days available
4. Flag if approaching or exceeding the limit

**Important Notes:**
â€¢ Days are counted from midnight to midnight
â€¢ Partial days count as full days
â€¢ Travel days count toward the limit
â€¢ The window rolls forward each day

**Example:**
If you spent 45 days in France in the last 180 days, you have 45 days remaining in your current window.

sections.title: Adding Employee Trips
sections.content:
There are three ways to add trips to the system:

**Method 1: Individual Trips**
1. Go to the employee's detail page
2. Click 'Add Trip'
3. Enter departure and return dates
4. Select destination country
5. Add any notes
6. Save the trip

**Method 2: Bulk Trips**
1. Click 'Bulk Add Trip' in the sidebar
2. Select multiple employees
3. Enter the same trip details for all
4. Perfect for group travel or company events

**Method 3: Excel Import**
1. Prepare your Excel file (see Excel Import Guide)
2. Go to 'Import Excel' in the sidebar
3. Upload your file
4. Review the preview
5. Confirm the import

**Trip Information Required:**
â€¢ Employee name
â€¢ Departure date
â€¢ Return date
â€¢ Destination country
â€¢ Optional: Notes or purpose

**Best Practices:**
â€¢ Add trips as soon as they're booked
â€¢ Include all travel days (departure and return)
â€¢ Use consistent date formats
â€¢ Add notes for business trips vs. personal travel

sections.title: Adding Private Holiday Trips
sections.content:
Employees can have their personal holiday trips recorded with maximum privacy protection.

**How to Add Private Trips:**
1. Employee notifies admin of holiday dates (verbally or by email)
2. Admin goes to employee's detail page
3. Click 'Add Trip'
4. Select 'ðŸ”’ Personal Trip (Dates Only)' from country dropdown
5. Enter entry and exit dates
6. Save the trip

**Privacy Protection:**
â€¢ Only dates are stored (no destination country)
â€¢ Country appears as 'Personal Trip' in all admin views
â€¢ Details are completely hidden from admin interface
â€¢ Days still count toward 90/180 compliance

**Important Notes:**
â€¢ Private trips are protected from 'Clear All Data' operations
â€¢ Can be manually deleted if employee plans change
â€¢ DSAR exports include full details for the employee
â€¢ Excel imports never include private trips (business travel only)

**When to Use:**
â€¢ Employee taking personal holiday to EU/Schengen area
â€¢ Vacation time that affects 90/180 compliance
â€¢ Any personal travel that needs to be counted

**Admin Workflow:**
â€¢ Employee: 'I'm taking holiday Aug 1-10'
â€¢ Admin: Add trip with 'Personal Trip' country
â€¢ System: Stores dates only, counts toward compliance
â€¢ Result: Employee's compliance calculated correctly, privacy preserved

sections.title: Excel Import Guide
sections.content:
Import multiple trips quickly using Excel files. We support two formats:

**Format 1: Simple Trip List**
Columns: Employee Name | Departure Date | Return Date | Country

**Format 2: Detailed Schedule**
Columns: Employee Name | Start Date | End Date | Destination | Notes

**Excel File Requirements:**
â€¢ First row must contain column headers
â€¢ Dates in format: DD/MM/YYYY or YYYY-MM-DD
â€¢ Country names must match our database
â€¢ No empty rows between data
â€¢ Maximum 1000 rows per import

**Supported Countries:**
â€¢ All 26 Schengen countries
â€¢ Ireland (tracked separately)
â€¢ UK (for reference only)

**Step-by-Step Import:**
1. Prepare your Excel file with correct format
2. Go to 'Import Excel' in the sidebar
3. Click 'Choose File' and select your Excel file
4. Review the preview table
5. Check for any errors or warnings
6. Click 'Import Trips' to confirm
7. View the import summary

**Common Issues:**
â€¢ Date format errors - use DD/MM/YYYY
â€¢ Country name mismatches - check spelling
â€¢ Missing required columns - ensure all headers present
â€¢ Duplicate trips - system will warn about conflicts

**Tips for Success:**
â€¢ Use the sample file as a template
â€¢ Test with a small file first
â€¢ Keep backup of original data
â€¢ Review preview carefully before importing

sections.content:

Forecasting shows you how future trips will affect your 90/180 day compliance, helping you make informed travel decisions.

**How to Use Forecasting:**
1. Go to an employee's detail page
2. Click 'Forecast Trip'
3. Enter proposed travel dates

5. View the impact analysis

**Forecast Results Show:**

**Planning Scenarios:**

**Forecast Features:**
â€¢ Real-time calculations

**Best Practices:**

**Risk Levels:**

sections.title: Schengen Country Codes
sections.content:
Complete reference for all Schengen Area countries and their codes used in the system.

**Schengen Area Countries (26):**

**Western Europe:**
â€¢ Austria (AT)
â€¢ Belgium (BE)
â€¢ France (FR)
â€¢ Germany (DE)
â€¢ Luxembourg (LU)
â€¢ Netherlands (NL)
â€¢ Switzerland (CH)

**Northern Europe:**
â€¢ Denmark (DK)
â€¢ Finland (FI)
â€¢ Iceland (IS)
â€¢ Norway (NO)
â€¢ Sweden (SE)

**Southern Europe:**
â€¢ Greece (GR)
â€¢ Italy (IT)
â€¢ Malta (MT)
â€¢ Portugal (PT)
â€¢ Spain (ES)

**Eastern Europe:**
â€¢ Czech Republic (CZ)
â€¢ Estonia (EE)
â€¢ Hungary (HU)
â€¢ Latvia (LV)
â€¢ Lithuania (LT)
â€¢ Poland (PL)
â€¢ Slovakia (SK)
â€¢ Slovenia (SI)

**Special Cases:**
â€¢ **Ireland (IE)**: EU member but not in Schengen - tracked separately
â€¢ **UK (GB)**: No longer in EU - for reference only
â€¢ **Croatia (HR)**: Recently joined Schengen (2023)

**Country Selection Tips:**
â€¢ Use the full country name when adding trips
â€¢ The system will auto-complete as you type
â€¢ Check the spelling if a country doesn't appear
â€¢ Some countries have multiple names (e.g., Netherlands/Holland)

**Important Notes:**
â€¢ All Schengen countries count toward the 90-day limit
â€¢ Ireland does NOT count toward the limit
â€¢ Travel between Schengen countries doesn't require new entry
â€¢ The 90/180 rule applies to the entire Schengen Area as one zone

**Troubleshooting:**
â€¢ If a country doesn't appear, check the spelling
â€¢ Some territories have special status (e.g., French overseas territories)
â€¢ Contact support if you need to add a new country
â€¢ The system is regularly updated with border changes

sections.title: Troubleshooting & FAQ
sections.content:
Common issues and solutions for the EU Trip Tracker.

**Frequently Asked Questions:**

**Q: Why is my employee showing as 'At Risk'?**
A: This means they have less than 10 days remaining in their 180-day window, or they've exceeded the 90-day limit. Check their trip history and consider postponing future travel.

**Q: How do I correct a trip that was entered incorrectly?**
A: Go to the employee's detail page, find the trip, and click 'Edit'. Make your changes and save. The system will recalculate their status automatically.

**Q: Can I import trips from other systems?**
A: Yes, use the Excel import feature. Download the sample file to see the required format, then upload your data.

**Q: What if an employee travels to Ireland?**
A: Ireland is tracked separately and doesn't count toward the 90/180 limit. Select 'Ireland' as the destination when adding the trip.

**Q: How often should I check the dashboard?**
A: We recommend checking weekly, or before approving any new travel. The system will show warnings for employees approaching their limits.

**Q: Can I export data for HR records?**
A: Yes, use the 'Export Data' feature to generate CSV files or PDF reports suitable for HR record-keeping.

**Common Issues:**

**Problem: Dashboard not loading**
â€¢ Check your internet connection
â€¢ Clear browser cache
â€¢ Try a different browser
â€¢ Contact IT support

**Problem: Can't add trips**
â€¢ Ensure you're logged in
â€¢ Check date format (DD/MM/YYYY)
â€¢ Verify country name spelling
â€¢ Try refreshing the page

**Problem: Excel import failing**
â€¢ Check file format matches sample
â€¢ Ensure no empty rows
â€¢ Verify date formats
â€¢ Check country names

**Problem: Calculations seem wrong**
â€¢ Check trip dates are correct
â€¢ Verify destination countries
â€¢ Look for overlapping trips
â€¢ Contact support for review

**Getting Help:**

â€¢ Contact your system administrator
â€¢ Submit a support ticket

**System Requirements:**

â€¢ Screen resolution 1024x768 or higher

**Performance Tips:**

â€¢ Clear browser cache regularly
â€¢ Use a wired internet connection
â€¢ Avoid using during peak hours
